answers.answer: It's possible but not concrete every pregnancy is different it doesn't necissarily mean you will develop it and deliver early. Just be aware of the signs and try to take things easy and drink a lot of water. A lot of movement and dehydration make contractions worse roo

question: I've had Braxton hicks since I was about 19 weeks. I am now 28 weeks and they have progressed vigorously. My doctor prescribed me medicine in which they are not as often but the intensity is still the same. Is it possible for me to deliver early? Also I developed preeclampsia with my first child. I delivered at 36 weeks. Is it a possibility i can develop b it with my second child and also have him early?
title: Braxton Hicks/preeclampsia
